trans-unit.source: When this creature enters the battlefield, roll a six-sided die. You gain life equal to the result.
AWOL
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: Exile target attacking creature. Then remove it from the game. Then put it into the absolutely-removed-from-the-freaking-game-forever zone.
Emcee
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may stand up and say in a deep, booming voice, "Presenting . . . " and that creature's name. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.
The ogre appealed the match loss and got it downgraded to a warning.

{T}: Choose target spell or ability that targets a permanent you control. Then ask a person outside the game if the story of what will happen makes sense. If they say no, sacrifice Flavor Judge and counter that spell or ability.
"...and now they're trying to make a brick wall on my property fight a dinosaur to the death."
Frankie Peanuts
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may ask target player a yes-or-no question. If you do, that player answers the question truthfully and abides by that answer if able until end of turn.
Don't cross him or you'll end up sleeping with the merfolk.

trans-unit.resname: UND·6 | GO TO JAIL | Card Text
trans-unit.source: When GO TO JAIL enters the battlefield, exile target creature an opponent controls until GO TO JAIL leaves the battlefield. At the beginning of the upkeep of the exiled card's owner, that player rolls two six-sided dice. If they roll doubles, sacrifice GO TO JAIL.
Flying Whenever you attack with two or more creatures, Augment {3}{W} ({3}{W}, Reveal this card from your hand: Combine it with target host. Augment only as a sorcery.)

(To do the Hokey Pokey, choose an arm, a leg, or your whole self and put it in. Put it out. Put it in. Shake it all about. You do the Hokey Pokey Turn yourself around.)

trans-unit.source: Ban a card other than a basic land card for the rest of the match. (All cards with that name in any zone or sideboard are removed from the match.)

trans-unit.source: Few understand the DCI's rigorous decision-making process.

"You say you're capable of flying. You got any proof of that?"

When this creature enters the battlefield, exile target creature card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your graveyard. If it has augment, combine it with a host you control. Otherwise, put it onto the battlefield.

Whenever you cast a wordy spell, scry 2. (A spell is wordy if it has four or more lines of rules text.) {1}{R}, {T}: Choose target creature you don't control. Reveal the top card of your library. trans-unit.source: If you would roll a die, instead roll two of those dice and ignore one of those results.

trans-unit.resname: UND·79 | Krark's Other Thumb | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: Krark was the kind of goblin who'd lose his thumb in a wager and come right back with "Double or nothing!"
Paper Tiger

trans-unit.source: Creatures named Rock Lobster can't attack or block.
The tiger is always quick to fold.

trans-unit.resname: UND·81 | Pointy Finger of Doom | Card Text
trans-unit.source: {3}, {T}: Spin Pointy Finger of Doom in the middle of the table so that it rotates completely at least once, then destroy the closest permanent the finger points to.

trans-unit.resname: UND·81 | Pointy Finger of Doom | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: Nails and destruction on point.

Nothing beats the lizard's shear power.

trans-unit.resname: UND·84 | Sword of Dungeons & Dragons | Card Text
UND·85 | Water Gun Balloon Game | Card Name
trans-unit.source: Water Gun Balloon Game
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.resname: UND·85 | Water Gun Balloon Game | Card Text
trans-unit.source: As Water Gun Balloon Game enters the battlefield, each player puts a pop counter on "0." Whenever a player casts a spell, move that player's pop counter up one. Whenever a player's pop counter hits "5," that player creates a 5/5 pink Giant Teddy Bear creature token and resets all pop counters to "0."
{T}: Add {C}. {T}: Add one mana of any color. Spend this mana only to pay silver-bordered costs.
In that battleground of a ring, the rules aren't nearly so black and white.
